intro: Hieracium rupestre, commonly known as the rock hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are upright and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Hieracium rupestre produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
